page.title: 09BISHOPS VILLAGE NEWS
page.content: In 1969 two boys whose surname was CLAY and lived in Poplar Road, decided that they would start a village newspaper. They decided to call it{ {Bishops Itchington Village Gazette,} and it was on a single sheet of A4 size paper. They collected all the news and articles themselves, and printed jokes and quizes. The whole family was involved in the writing, editing and duplicating. They sold it door to door for{2d.} After two years, their Father got a new job and they all left the village. The magazine was taken over by Mrs. Audrey Bench who produced it for a number of years. Eventually the magazine lapsed. A small group of volunteers met to discuss the possibilities of starting a{village magazine}i.e. equipment, finances, layout etc. They decided
